meanings.definition: The act of assessing or appraising something.
meanings.sent1: Teachers use evaluations to understand how well students are learning.
meanings.sent2: I always appreciate receiving evaluations from my boss to improve my work performance.
meanings.sent3: The evaluations of the new restaurant were so positive that everyone wanted to try it.
meanings.sent4: Her evaluations of the situation were like a spotlight, revealing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The evaluations of the artwork were so detailed, it felt like looking through a magnifying glass.

meanings.definition: A judgment or opinion about something.
meanings.sent1: His evaluations of the movie were mixed, some liked it while others didn't.
meanings.sent2: I value your evaluations on the matter, as they help me make decisions.
meanings.sent3: The evaluations of the weather forecast were surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: Her evaluations of people's characters were like reading a book with hidden chapters.
meanings.sent5: The evaluations of the book were so varied, it was like hearing different songs in one melody.

meanings.definition: The process of determining the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: The evaluations of the antique vase revealed it was worth a lot of money.
meanings.sent2: Insurance companies often require evaluations of damaged property to determine compensation.
meanings.sent3: The evaluations of the old car's value made the owner realize it was a hidden gem.
meanings.sent4: Her evaluations of the real estate market were like predicting the future.
meanings.sent5: The evaluations of the diamond's worth were so precise, it felt like measuring time in carats.
